pageContent: Purpose: Several studies have examined the association between polyunsaturated fatty acids and prostate cancer risk. We evaluated the evidence on the association between the essential polyunsaturated fatty acid, known as alpha-linolenic acid, and the risk of prostate cancer in humans.

metaData.source:
[Prostate cancer in the elderly patient]
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17214231/
